White House says British PM Sunak was only meeting his 'legal obligation' when he said the UK 'discourages' Ukraine's use of cluster bombs - and there WON'T be 'fracture' over U.S. providing the deadly munitions
09/07/23 09:47
'I do not think you will see fracture, division or disunity' over the U.S. decision to provide cluster bombs to Ukraine, said national security advisor Jake Sullivan. He spoke after British PM Rishi Sunak said he 'discourages' their use. Sullivan said Sunak 'fulfilled his obligation' given that Britain is a signatory to a convention banning use of the weapons.
